definition: edge of a tortoiseshell/see 冉冉[ran3 ran3]
edge of a tortoiseshell/see 冉冉[ran3 ran3]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: S: It seems like you are rising up to a Chinese pop star.
sentences.chinese: 看来你正成为一颗冉冉上升的中国明星。

sentences.english: It is a cigarette-end from it gently rises a thread of smoke.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个烟蒂，一缕烟还在冉冉上升。

sentences.english: And others’ balloons may rise in the meantime.
sentences.chinese: 其他人同时也在冉冉上升。

sentences.english: Two great white clouds rising up slowly, and majestically from the depths of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 他观察到两大朵云从地球内部雄伟壮观地冉冉上升。

definition: to skyrocket/to get quick promotion in one's career
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to be on the verge of eruption (idiom)/(of the sun) to emerge in all its brilliance
multicolored sunlight of sunrise or sunset
